intro: Heterotaxis brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its star-shaped, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has opposite leaves that are ovate to elliptic in shape, with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species and is of interest for conservation efforts.
